info.title: Payment Initiation 3.1
info.description: Initiate payments for Investec UK Private Banking clients who are using your products and services.

parameters.name: consentId
parameters.description: Domestic payment consent id

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below:Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU’s IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

400.description: A validation exception has occurred or the resource has not been found

403.description: Not permitted to make this request

post.description:
Create a domestic payment consent
            
------
- Debtor account and currency must be in GBP
- Once consent has been successfully created, the consent must be authorised and payment be made within 24 hours (from the CreationDateTime)
------

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below:Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU’s IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

400.description: A validation exception has occurred or the resource has not been found

403.description: Not permitted to make this request

post.description:
Create a domestic payment
            
------
- The submission of the payment must be made within 24-hours of the consent creation
- Debtor account and currency must be in GBP
------

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent

post.description:
Create a domestic scheduled payment consent
            
------
- Debtor account and currency must be in GBP
- RequestedExecutionDateTime must be between tomorrow and six months from now
- Once consent has been successfully created, the consent must be authorised and payment be made within 24 hours (from the CreationDateTime)
------

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below:Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU’s IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

400.description: A validation exception has occurred or the resource has not been found

403.description: Not permitted to make this request

post.description:
Create a domestic standing order consent
------
- Debtor account and currency must be in GBP
- Once consent has been successfully created, the consent must be authorised
- The first payment amount will also be the recurring and final payment amounts
- FirstPaymentDateTime and FinalPaymentDateTime need not contain a time element. Dates passed with a time element will have time removed before submission.
------

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below:Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU’s IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

400.description: A validation exception has occurred or the resource has not been found

403.description: Not permitted to make this request

post.description:
Create an international payment consent
            
------
- Debtor account and currency must be one of the following: AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, EUR, GBP, HKD, ILS, JPY, NOK, SEK, SGD, USD, ZAR
- Expiry datetime of the exchange rate will be 10 minutes from successful consent submission
------

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below:Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU’s IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

400.description: A validation exception has occurred or the resource has not been found

403.description: Not permitted to make this request

ConsentId.description: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the consent resource.

CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource was created.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

StatusUpdateDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the consent resource status was updated.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

FirstAvailableDateTime.description:
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

LastAvailableDateTime.description:
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

MetaData.description: Meta Data relevant to the payload

InstructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the
instruction.
Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party
and the
instructed party to refer to the individual instruction.It can be included in several messages related to the
instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.description:
Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This
identification is
passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for
reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction.It can be included in several messages related to the
transaction.
OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for the EndToEndIdentification field.

OBDomestic2.description:
<description>
                    The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP.It is used to request movement of funds
                    from
                    the debtor account to a creditor for a single domestic payment.
                </description>

Amount.description:
A number of monetary units specified in an active currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant
    with ISO 4217.
Any value greater than 2 decimal places will be rounded to 2 decimal places on submission

OBActiveOrHistoricCurrencyAndAmount.description:
<description>
                    Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the
                    currency as ordered by the initiating party.
                    Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.
                </description>

SchemeName.description:
Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.
<example>List [ "UK.OBIE.BBAN", "UK.OBIE.IBAN", "UK.OBIE.PAN", "UK.OBIE.Paym", "UK.OBIE.SortCodeAccountNumber" ]</example>

Identification.description:
Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account
owner.

Name.description:
Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution.
Usage: The account name is the name or names of the account owner(s) represented at an account level. The account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.
OB: ASPSPs may carry out name validation for Confirmation of Payee, but it is not mandatory.

OBCashAccountCreditor3.description: <description>Provides the details to identify the beneficiary account.</description>

SchemeName.description:
Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.
The supported scheme name is "UK.OBIE.SortCodeAccountNumber"

Identification.description:
Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account
owner.

OBCashAccountDebtor4.description: <description>Provides the details to identify the debtor account.</description>

Reference.description:
Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.
Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information,
to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.
If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one
identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance
identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.
OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only accept 18 characters for the ReferenceInformation field - which is where
this ISO field will be mapped.

OBRemittanceInformation1.description: Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system.

PayerReference.description: The reference shown in the PSU's transaction narratives

OBSupplementaryData1.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

FundsAvailableDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the funds availability check was generated.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

FundsAvailable.description: Flag to indicate the availability of funds given the Amount in the consent request.

ConsentId.description: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the consent resource.

DomesticPaymentId.description: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the domestic payment resource.

ConsentId.description: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the consent resource.

CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the message was created.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

StatusUpdateDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource status was updated.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource was created.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

StatusUpdateDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the consent resource status was updated.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

InstructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for 
an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction.
Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point 
reference that can be used between the instructing party and 
the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. 
It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.description:
Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to 
unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification 
is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.
Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for 
reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction.
It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.
The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters 
for the EndToEndIdentification field.

RequestedExecutionDateTime.description:
Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing 
agent to process the payment.
Usage: This is the date on which the debtor’s account is to 
be debited.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 
date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.
An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

OBDomesticScheduled2.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for a single scheduled domestic payment.

Frequency.description:
Individual Definitions:
EvryDay - Every day
IntrvlWkDay - An interval specified in weeks(01 to 09), and the day within the week(01 to 07)
IntrvlMnthDay - An interval specified in months(between 01 to 06, 12, 24), specifying the day within the month(-05
to -01, 1 to 31)
Individual Patterns:
EvryDay (ScheduleCode)
IntrvlWkDay:IntervalInWeeks:DayInWeek(ScheduleCode + IntervalInWeeks + DayInWeek)
IntrvlMnthDay:IntervalInMonths:DayInMonth(ScheduleCode + IntervalInMonths + DayInMonth)
The regular expression for this element combines five smaller versions for each permitted pattern.To aid legibility
- the components are presented individually here:
EvryDay
IntrvlWkDay:0[1]:0[1-7]
IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])

FirstPaymentDateTime.description:
This value will be used for:
- The date on which the first payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.
- Calculating the date on which the first recurring payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.
- Calculating the date on which the final payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

FinalPaymentDateTime.description:
This value will be used for:
- The date on which the final payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.
- Calculating the date on which the first recurring payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.
- Calculating the date on which the final payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

UnitCurrency.description:
Currency in which the rate of exchange is expressed in a currency exchange. In the example 1GBP = xxxCUR, the unit currency is GBP.
Must be one of the following: AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, EUR, GBP, HKD, ILS, JPY, NOK, SEK, SGD, USD, ZAR

ExchangeRate.description:
The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another.
This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.

ExpirationDateTime.description:
Specified date and time the exchange rate agreement will expire.
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

OBExchangeRate2.description: Further detailed information on the exchange rate that has been used in the payment transaction.

InstructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the
instruction.
Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party
and the
instructed party to refer to the individual instruction.It can be included in several messages related to the
instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.description:
Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This
identification is
passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for
reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction.It can be included in several messages related to the
transaction.
OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for the EndToEndIdentification field.

CurrencyOfTransfer.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor’s account.

OBInternational1.description:
The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. 
It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for a single international payment.

UnitCurrency.description:
Currency in which the rate of exchange is expressed in a currency exchange. In the example 1GBP = xxxCUR, the unit currency is GBP.
Must be one of the following: AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, EUR, GBP, HKD, ILS, JPY, NOK, SEK, SGD, USD, ZAR

OBExchangeRate1.description: Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of the servicing institution.

OBBranchAndFinancialInstitutionIdentific.description:
Party that manages the account on behalf of the account owner, that is manages the registration and booking of entries on the account,
calculates balances on the account and provides information about the account.
This is the servicer of the beneficiary account.
